page.title: 18Garden Flowers and Trees.
page.content:
Maule Street in Carnoustie was chosen as a guide to the sort of flowers and trees which are most popular in the area.The most common flower which is grown is the rose, red and orange being the usual colours.The least common were the marsh-marigolds. Daffodils are also popular but weren't in bloom when the survey was done and the same was true for primroses.
The survey showed that the Japanese Cherry was the most commonly grown tree.This may be because the tree has beautiful blossom and a strong fra- grance which lasts throughout spring. There weren't very many holly trees although their leaves are popular at Christmas time. The elm and the ash were not grown in any gardens but they can be seen in the parks and countryside.
